|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 74K |cpu1_type_rev = |cpu1spd = 600 |is_doc = |bus = 8-bit |flash1type = |fla1_num = 2 |fla1chip = Samsung;K9F1G08U0D-SCB0; |flash1size = 128 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 128 |ram1chip = Samsung;K4T51163Q1-HCE6; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |sw1chip = Broadcom;BCM53115; |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = IEEE 802.3/3u/3ab |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = 20:4E:7F, 74:44:01, 84:1B:5E, E0:46:9A |oui = 20:4E:7F, 74:44:01, 84:1B:5E, E0:46:9A |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = |exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_sim_num = |exp_pcmcia_num = |exp_expcard_num = |exp_minipci_num = |exp_minipcie_num = |exp_usb_num = 2 |exp_cf_num = |exp_sdmmc_num = |exp_ide_num = |exp_ata_num = |exp_sata_num = |exp_esata_num = |exp_parallel = |exp_sfp_num = |exp_M.2 = |exp_hdmi_num = |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = 2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE2605L;SiGe, 2605L, 151AJ;3; ,,, 5GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE5003L1;5003L1, 142AU;3; |802dot11_protocols = abgn |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = password |defaultssid = NETGEARXX, NETGEARXX-5G |defaultssid_regex = ^NETGEAR[0-9]{2}$,,, ^NETGEAR[0-9]{2}-5G$ |default_ch = |manuf = Foxconn |manuf_model = U12H189 |manuf_rev = T00 |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT, FreshTomato |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 07/29/2011 |estreldate = 09/14/2011 |estprice = 180 |upc = 606449077360 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B005KG44V0 |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4331; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 3 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/n |rad1n = 450 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 5 |rad1correv = |rad1cap = |wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4331; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad2n = 450 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4 |rad2correv = |rad2cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== Manuf. by [[Foxconn]]/Hon Hai (per [http://www.downloads.netgear.com/files/WNDR4500-V1.0.0.40_1.0.10.chk this firmware file], the internal model :is probably U12H189 [U12H189T00], file is nearly 8MB) The source code for the device is available on [ftp://downloads.netgear.com/files/GPL/ Netgear's FTP server]. :Each wireless interface has three U.FL connectors. The BCM4706 has a MIPS32 74K core and identifies as a BCM5300. The default SSIDs appear to be '''NETGEARXX''' and '''NETGEARXX-5G''' :where '''XX''' is a number. ==Links of Interest== ===Links=== *[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?pid=149569 On the '''OpenWrt''' forums] {{OpenWrtTechData|https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/netgear/netgear_wndr4500}}{{OpenWrtWiki|http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/netgear/wndr4500}} *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=145503&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=0 On the '''DD-WRT''' forums] *[http://tomatousb.org/forum/t-412488 On the '''TomatoUSB''' forums] *[http://www.myopenrouter.com/download/38649/DD-WRT-for-NETGEAR-WNDR4500-Initial-Release/ ''Tathagata Das''' initial DD-WRT build for this router] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=155601 and discussion of this build on the '''DD-WRT''' forums] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=148991 Netgear WNDR4500 info with INTERNAL PICS + CFE DUMP] on the '''DD-WRT''' forums This router is sold by ''Costco'' as the ''R4500'' (OUI 84:1B:5E). :[http://kb.netgear.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/22235 The Readyshare Cloud and Apple's Time Machine
are not supported on the R4500]. ===Reviews=== *[https://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/31603-netgear-wndr4500-n900-wireless-dual-band-gigabit-router-reviewed Reviewed on SmallNetBuilder] and [https://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/31621-netgear-wndr4500-retest retested] *[http://www.maximumpc.com/article/reviews/netgear_wndr4500_wi-fi_router_review Reviewed on MaximumPC] *[http://www.slashgear.com/netgear-wndr4500-review-14178914/ Reviewed on SlashGear] *[http://reviews.cnet.com/routers/netgear-wndr4500-n900-wireless/4505-3319_7-35017823.html Reviewed on CNet] *[http://www.foxnetwork.ru/index.php/en/component/content/article/120-netgear-wndr4500.html Reviewed on FoxNetwork] *[http://openlinksys.info/forum/viewthread.php?thread_id=14238 Reviewed by shibby (PL)], *[http://translate.google.pl/translate?sl=pl&tl=en&js=n&prev=_t&hl=pl&ie=UTF-8&layout=2&eotf=1&u=http%3A%2F%2Fopenlinksys.info%2Fforum%2Fviewthread.php%3Fthread_id%3D14238 in English] :Dual Flash, 2MB and 128MB NAND (74:44:01 OUI) :NETGEAR and NETGEAR-5G SSIDs, not NETGEARXX(-5G) ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== [https://forum.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Netgear_WNDR4500 On the '''DD-WRT''' Wiki] Supported by dd-wrt as of = wndr4500 build 21606 20130516 Please insert instructions here ===Flashing Tomato=== Please insert instructions here ==Pictures== All pictures are from [http://www.netgear.fr/presse/photos.php?prod=WNDR4500 Netgear France].
